references: A. T. Benjamin and J. J. Quinn, Proofs that really count: the art of combinatorial proof, M.A.A. 2003, p. 15.
links: Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1, 1).
formula: a(n) = round( (4phi-2) phi^n) (works for n>4). - _Thomas Baruchel_, Sep 08 2004a(n) = 10F(n) = F(n+4) + F(n+2) + F(n-2) + F(n-4), n>3.G.f.: 10*x/(1-x-x^2). - _Philippe Del√©ham_, Nov 20 2008
mathematica: a={};b=0;c=10;AppendTo[a, b];AppendTo[a, c];Do[b=b+c;AppendTo[a, b];c=b+c;AppendTo[a, c], {n, 4!}];a (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Sep 17 2008 *)
